chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: To the chief Musician, A Song or Psalm.
items.plainText: To the chief Musician, A Song or Psalm.

items.text: Make a joyful noise unto God, all ye lands:
items.plainText: Make a joyful noise unto God, all ye lands:

items.text: Sing forth the honour of his name: make his praise glorious.
items.plainText: Sing forth the honour of his name: make his praise glorious.

items.text: Say unto God, How terrible art thou in thy works! through the greatness of thy power shall thine enemies submit themselves unto thee.
items.plainText: Say unto God, How terrible art thou in thy works! through the greatness of thy power shall thine enemies submit themselves unto thee.

items.text: All the earth shall worship thee, and shall sing unto thee; they shall sing to thy name. Selah.
items.plainText: All the earth shall worship thee, and shall sing unto thee; they shall sing to thy name. Selah.

items.text: Come and see the works of God: he is terrible in his doing toward the children of men.
items.plainText: Come and see the works of God: he is terrible in his doing toward the children of men.

items.text: He turned the sea into dry land: they went through the flood on foot: there did we rejoice in him.
items.plainText: He turned the sea into dry land: they went through the flood on foot: there did we rejoice in him.

items.text: He ruleth by his power for ever; his eyes behold the nations: let not the rebellious exalt themselves. Selah.
items.plainText: He ruleth by his power for ever; his eyes behold the nations: let not the rebellious exalt themselves. Selah.

items.text: O bless our God, ye people, and make the voice of his praise to be heard:
items.plainText: O bless our God, ye people, and make the voice of his praise to be heard:

items.text: Which holdeth our soul in life, and suffereth not our feet to be moved.
items.plainText: Which holdeth our soul in life, and suffereth not our feet to be moved.

items.text: For thou, O God, hast proved us: thou hast tried us, as silver is tried.
items.plainText: For thou, O God, hast proved us: thou hast tried us, as silver is tried.

items.text: Thou broughtest us into the net; thou laidst affliction upon our loins.
items.plainText: Thou broughtest us into the net; thou laidst affliction upon our loins.

items.text: Thou hast caused men to ride over our heads; we went through fire and through water: but thou broughtest us out into a wealthy place.
items.plainText: Thou hast caused men to ride over our heads; we went through fire and through water: but thou broughtest us out into a wealthy place.

items.text: I will go into thy house with burnt offerings: I will pay thee my vows,
items.plainText: I will go into thy house with burnt offerings: I will pay thee my vows,

items.text: Which my lips have uttered, and my mouth hath spoken, when I was in trouble.
items.plainText: Which my lips have uttered, and my mouth hath spoken, when I was in trouble.

items.text: I will offer unto thee burnt sacrifices of fatlings, with the incense of rams; I will offer bullocks with goats. Selah.
items.plainText: I will offer unto thee burnt sacrifices of fatlings, with the incense of rams; I will offer bullocks with goats. Selah.

items.text: Come and hear, all ye that fear God, and I will declare what he hath done for my soul.
items.plainText: Come and hear, all ye that fear God, and I will declare what he hath done for my soul.

items.text: I cried unto him with my mouth, and he was extolled with my tongue.
items.plainText: I cried unto him with my mouth, and he was extolled with my tongue.

items.text: If I regard iniquity in my heart, the Lord will not hear me:
items.plainText: If I regard iniquity in my heart, the Lord will not hear me:

items.text: But verily God hath heard me; he hath attended to the voice of my prayer.
items.plainText: But verily God hath heard me; he hath attended to the voice of my prayer.

items.text: Blessed be God, which hath not turned away my prayer, nor his mercy from me.
items.plainText: Blessed be God, which hath not turned away my prayer, nor his mercy from me.
